references.reason: This paper is a technical report on GPT-4, a large language model which is relevant to the current research on text-to-image generation and adversarial guidance.

references.paper_title: Re-imagine the negative prompt algorithm: Transform 2d diffusion into 3d, alleviate janus problem and beyond
references.reason: This paper is relevant because it explores the use of negative prompts, a key technique in adversarial guidance, to improve the diversity and quality of outputs in diffusion models.

references.paper_title: Understanding the impact of negative prompts: When and how do they take effect?
references.reason: This paper investigates the effects of negative prompts, which is a related technique to the one proposed in the paper, and helps to understand their impact on the generation process in diffusion models.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces Flux, a diffusion model architecture that the current work is compatible with and is shown to improve upon.  It is highly relevant as it describes a model used in the experiments.
This paper introduces classifier-free guidance, a widely used technique in diffusion models for improving the quality and control over the generated images, that the current work builds upon.
